study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of tissue flossing on ankle joint flexibility, plantarflexor strength, and soleus H reflex in martial arts fighters.
results_summary: Tissue flossing around the calf (CALF) significantly reduced the soleus H reflex during and after the intervention, but ankle flexibility and plantarflexor strength remained unaffected. H reflexes returned to baseline levels 10 minutes post-intervention.
population_specificity: Eleven young martial arts fighters (16.6 ± 1.2 years).
effective_dosage: 3 sets of 2 min flossing with 2 min rest (ankle or calf).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to demonstrate how martial arts, through the lens of rough-and-tumble play (RTP), contributes to psychosocial development beyond contextual factors.
results_summary: The study argues that martial arts, resembling RTP, fosters self-regulation, empathy, and prosocial behavior, providing a framework for practitioners to explain its developmental benefits. It challenges the notion that only contextual factors drive developmental outcomes in sports.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on martial arts practitioners and psychosocial development).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of martial arts on quality of life (QoL) and cancer-related fatigue (CRF) in cancer patients and survivors.
results_summary: Martial arts significantly improved social function and reduced CRF compared to controls, though results were inconsistent across measurement methods. The overall effects on QoL and CRF were deemed inconclusive, highlighting the need for larger, more homogeneous trials.
population_specificity: Cancer patients and survivors (1103 participants across 17 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a 10-week martial arts training program could effectively promote resilience in secondary school students as a sports-based mental health intervention.
results_summary: The study found that the martial arts intervention significantly improved students' resilience, with stronger effects immediately post-intervention compared to the 12-week follow-up. The intervention group showed better resilience outcomes than the control group.
population_specificity: 283 secondary school students aged 12-14 years.
effective_dosage: 10-week martial arts training program (specific frequency not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether wet-cupping could reduce exercise-induced inflammation in martial arts athletes.
results_summary: Cupping therapy significantly reduced IL-6 and TNF-α levels compared to exercise alone, suggesting it may mitigate inflammation. However, combining cupping with exercise still led to increased inflammatory markers post-exercise.
population_specificity: 21 male karate athletes
study_duration: Single session (assessed immediately, 30 min, and 24 h post-intervention)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether martial arts training could serve as an effective sports-based mental health intervention, focusing on wellbeing, internalising mental health, and aggression.
results_summary: Martial arts training showed a small positive effect on wellbeing and a medium effect on internalising mental health, but only a minimal non-significant effect on reducing aggression. The results, though varied, support martial arts as a beneficial mental health intervention.
population_specificity: Not specified (general population inferred from meta-analysis of multiple studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Kids Kicking Cancer (KKC), a martial arts-based therapy, could reduce pain and emotional distress in children with chronic health conditions and their healthy siblings.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in pain (p = 0.033) and emotional distress (p < 0.001) after a 1-hour KKC class, with 50% and 89% of participants reporting improvements, respectively. Higher pre-class pain and distress levels correlated with greater reductions, and most participants (96%) would recommend KKC to others.
population_specificity: Children aged 5-17 years with chronic health conditions (e.g., cancer, sickle cell) or healthy siblings of such children.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to quantify typical training load and periodisation practices of MMA athletes, comparing those preparing for competitive bouts versus those who were not.
results_summary: The study found no significant changes in training duration, load, fatigue, or soreness within or between weeks, except for an abrupt taper before bouts. Training intensity distribution was 20% high, 33% moderate, and 47% low, with striking drills dominating training time and MMA sparring being the least frequent. Periodisation of training load was largely absent in this cohort.
population_specificity: 14 MMA competitors (age 22.4 ± 4.4 years, body mass 71.3 ± 7.7 kg, stature 171 ± 9.9 cm), half training for competitive bouts and half not.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (training practices observed, not a supplement).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of martial arts interventions on anthropometric and body composition parameters in overweight and obese individuals.
results_summary: The meta-analyses did not show significant benefits of martial arts over control groups for body mass index, waist circumference, or body fat percentage. The study concluded that current evidence is insufficient to determine the effectiveness of martial arts for these outcomes due to methodological limitations and heterogeneity.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese individuals (258 participants across six studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the efficacy of a martial arts-based therapeutic intervention to improve mental health outcomes in adolescents.
results_summary: The study utilized a robust randomized controlled trial design to evaluate the intervention, suggesting potential efficacy, but final results were not provided in the abstract. The findings are expected to provide valuable evidence regarding martial arts training's impact on mental health.
population_specificity: Adolescents aged 11-14 years from government and Catholic secondary schools in New South Wales, Australia.
effective_dosage: 10 × 50-60 min sessions, once per week for 10 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a mixed martial arts (MMA) intervention in improving executive functions (EFs) in children with autism spectrum disorder (ASD).
results_summary: The MMA intervention group showed significantly better executive functions at post-test compared to the waitlist control group, indicating efficacy in improving EFs among children with ASD.
population_specificity: School-aged children with autism spectrum disorder (ASD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of a 10-week MMA and psychotherapy program on young males' mental health and identify factors influencing help-seeking behavior in at-risk males.
results_summary: The program improved mental health by providing structure, fitness, and personal growth through counseling, reducing stigma around psychotherapy, and fostering positive male relationships. Participants reported better relationships, work life, and self-esteem.
population_specificity: Young males aged 20-35 (M = 24.57) at risk for mental health challenges.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a martial arts-based psycho-social intervention could improve resilience and self-efficacy in secondary school students, as an alternative to traditional anti-bullying approaches.
results_summary: The intervention group showed improved resilience and self-efficacy, while the control group experienced declines. The findings suggest martial arts-based interventions may effectively enhance wellbeing outcomes relevant to bullying and mental health.
population_specificity: 283 secondary school students

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a short-term, high-intensity, low-volume MMA-specific strength and conditioning program improves performance in national-level MMA athletes compared to a regular training program.
results_summary: The specific training group showed significant improvements in aerobic fitness, strength, power, speed, and fat-free mass, while the regular training group showed no significant changes. The results suggest that MMA-specific training is more effective for performance enhancement in well-trained fighters.
population_specificity: National-level MMA athletes (n=17, divided into two groups).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of 9 months of martial arts practice (judo and Muay Thai) on cardiac autonomic modulation in healthy children and adolescents.
results_summary: After 9 months, judo training significantly improved cardiac autonomic modulation, evidenced by increased heart rate variability metrics (RMSSD and SD1) and greater dispersion in Poincaré plots. Muay Thai and the control group showed no improvement.
population_specificity: Healthy children and adolescents (59 participants, divided into judo, Muay Thai, and control groups).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to report a case of pitted keratolysis (PK) in a martial arts athlete and discuss the condition's diagnosis, treatment, and risk factors.
results_summary: The study found that PK, a bacterial skin infection, is common among martial arts athletes due to excessive sweating and barefoot training on tatami mats. Proper hygiene and topical antibiotic treatment (clindamycin 1% and benzoyl peroxide 5%) resolved the condition within one month.
population_specificity: A 32-year-old male martial arts athlete with hyperhidrosis and prolonged barefoot training.
effective_dosage: Clindamycin 1% and benzoyl peroxide 5% gel applied twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the health benefits of "hard" martial arts practice in adults, focusing on balance, cognitive function, musculoskeletal status, psychological health, cardiovascular fitness, and metabolic effects.
results_summary: The majority of studies reported positive effects from hard martial arts practice, including improvements in balance, cognitive function, and psychological health, with benefits potentially independent of age at commencement. However, methodological weaknesses affected the quality of evidence.
population_specificity: Adult population, with potential relevance to the elderly due to benefits in age-related declines.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Chinese martial arts training, particularly when combining skills and moral philosophy, could reduce reactive and proactive aggressive behavior in schoolchildren.
results_summary: The study found that only the combined skills-and-philosophy condition significantly reduced aggressive behavior, delinquent behavior, anxiety/depression, and attention problems at posttraining and 6-month follow-up compared to the placebo. Other conditions showed declines but were not statistically significant.
population_specificity: 298 schoolchildren (Grades 2-5) in Hong Kong with elevated aggression scores (z ≥ 1 on the Reactive-Proactive Aggression Questionnaire).
study_duration: Duration of training not explicitly stated; assessments were conducted at baseline, posttraining, and 6 months after training.

study_goal: The researchers sought to determine the influence of acute dehydration on physical performance and physiology in mixed martial arts (MMA) athletes.
results_summary: Acute dehydration of 4.8% body mass led to reduced performance in sled push, handgrip strength, and medicine ball chest throw 3 and 24 hours post-intervention, with no significant impact on vertical jump. Urine specific gravity remained elevated, indicating prolonged dehydration effects.
population_specificity: Mixed martial arts athletes (n = 14; age: 23 ± 4 years).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (dehydration protocol: 3-hour cycling at 60 W in 40°C to induce 5% dehydration).
study_duration: Performance testing occurred 3 and 24 hours post-intervention.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of physical lymphatic drainage methods (MLD, BF, DO) on postexercise regeneration of forearm muscles in MMA athletes.
results_summary: The study found that lymphatic drainage methods (MLD, DO, BF) significantly improved postexercise muscle strength recovery, reduced blood lactate concentration, and decreased muscle tension compared to the control group. These methods were effective in enhancing postexercise regeneration for MMA athletes.
population_specificity: Eighty MMA athletes aged 27.5 ± 6.4 years.
study_duration: Measurements were taken at rest, post-exercise, and at 20 minutes, 24, and 48 hours after PMLD application.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of martial arts intervention on pain perception and management in children with cancer.
results_summary: Martial arts intervention significantly reduced pain intensity in 85.3% of sessions, with greater reductions observed in older participants and those with higher baseline pain scores. The overall mean pain score decreased by 40% post-intervention.
population_specificity: Children with childhood malignancies (ages 3-19 years).
effective_dosage: 1-hour sessions (mean participation: 1.8±1.6 visits, range one to nine).
study_duration: Not explicitly stated (data collected over multiple sessions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of martial arts, particularly tai chi, on metabolic diseases and summarize existing evidence on its effectiveness.
results_summary: Tai chi shows potential benefits for obesity, glycemic control, blood pressure, and lipid profiles, but systematic reviews lack definitive conclusions due to small sample sizes and short trial durations. Limited evidence suggests other martial arts like kung fu and karate may improve body composition, glycemic control, and arterial stiffness.
population_specificity: Subjects with metabolic diseases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether cold-water immersion could effectively reduce biomarkers of muscle damage, inflammation, and physiological stress compared to passive recovery following a mixed martial arts training session.
results_summary: Cold-water immersion significantly attenuated increases in urinary neopterin, total neopterin, and saliva cortisol, reduced perceived soreness and fatigue, and lowered gastrointestinal temperatures without impairing functional performance compared to passive recovery.
population_specificity: Semiprofessional mixed martial arts (MMA) competitors (n = 15).
study_duration: Immediate post-session intervention with follow-up measurements at 1, 2, and 24 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare arterial stiffness and flexibility in middle-aged martial artists practicing Soo Bahk Do with sedentary controls to assess potential benefits of martial arts on vascular health.
results_summary: Middle-aged martial artists exhibited significantly lower arterial stiffness (PWV) and greater trunk and hamstring flexibility compared to sedentary controls, suggesting martial arts training may mitigate age-related arterial stiffness.
population_specificity: Healthy middle-aged adults (54.0 ± 2.0 years for martial artists, 54.7 ± 1.8 years for sedentary controls).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the prevalence and characteristics of injuries in Wushu competition during the 1st Asian Martial Arts Games 2009.
results_summary: The study found a high prevalence of injuries in Wushu, with females experiencing higher injury rates than males. The most common injuries were contusions and strain-sprains, primarily affecting the lower extremities, with receiving and delivering kicks being the leading mechanisms.
population_specificity: Sixty international athletes (38 males, 22 females) participating in Wushu competition during the 1st Asian Martial Arts Games 2009.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the relationships between training routines, concussive symptoms, and medical care in MMA athletes.
results_summary: Nearly 15% of MMA athletes reported a history of knockout, and nearly one-third reported a technical knockout. Many athletes returned to competition quickly after experiencing concussive symptoms, indicating potential risks.
population_specificity: MMA athletes (N=119)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if a corrective exercise program could improve functional movement screen (FMS) scores in MMA athletes.
results_summary: The intervention group showed significant improvements in FMS scores by week 4, with no further gains by week 8, and had fewer movement asymmetries compared to the control group. The study concluded that a 4-week intervention was sufficient for improving FMS scores.
population_specificity: Mixed martial arts (MMA) athletes
effective_dosage: Corrective exercise program 4 times per week

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of 12 weeks of martial arts exercise (MAE) on body composition, serum biomarkers, and quality of life in overweight/obese premenopausal women.
results_summary: The MAE group did not lose body weight but showed a significant decrease in fat-free mass and muscle mass compared to the control group. The MAE group also demonstrated an increase in serum IGF-I concentration but no changes in other biomarkers, suggesting potential benefits for body composition and quality of life.
population_specificity: Overweight/obese premenopausal women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the psychosocial aspects of mixed martial arts (MMA) and its association with youth violence in an Asian American and Pacific Islander (AAPI) adolescent sample.
results_summary: The study found that while MMA was popular among adolescents (52% enjoyed watching it, 24% practiced fight moves), MMA items were not uniquely associated with youth violence perpetration or victimization. Ethnic differences in MMA engagement were significant on a bivariate level but not when other variables were considered.
population_specificity: Asian American and Pacific Islander (AAPI) adolescents (N = 881).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to report a case of herpes gladiatorum (HG) in a professional MMA fighter and discuss the potential increase in HG prevalence due to the rising popularity of MMA.
results_summary: The study found that a professional MMA fighter contracted herpes gladiatorum after sparring with a new partner, leading to fever, facial rash, and eye involvement, requiring antiviral therapy. The authors suggest that the growing popularity of MMA may increase the prevalence of HG and other skin infections.
population_specificity: Professional mixed martial arts (MMA) fighter

study_goal: To systematically summarize the evidence for the effects of martial arts on health and fitness, and to provide a basis for future research on martial arts as an exercise prescription in exercise therapy.
results_summary: Most studies found positive effects on health, with tai chi being the most well-studied and beneficial for health promotion, especially among the elderly. Research on judo, karate, and taekwondo mainly focused on competitive abilities rather than health effects.
population_specificity: Varied (elderly, athletes, general martial arts practitioners)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the diagnostic challenges and potential severity of blunt force injuries in martial arts, particularly in children who may not recall traumatic events.
results_summary: The study found that minor trauma in judo training led to a massive hematoma in a child, initially undetected by sonography but confirmed via MRI. Staphylococcus aureus infection was identified intra-operatively, complicating the injury.
population_specificity: A 9-year-old girl with an unclear calf muscle injury.

study_goal: To evaluate the effectiveness of an eight-week, nonoperative rehabilitation program for managing a first-time, traumatic anterior shoulder dislocation in a mixed martial arts athlete.
results_summary: The study found that immobilization in external rotation combined with an intensive rehabilitation program successfully restored full range of motion and strength, with negative instability tests after eight weeks. The patient returned to pre-injury function without surgical intervention.
population_specificity: A 30-year-old mixed martial arts athlete with no prior shoulder injuries.
effective_dosage: Not applicable (rehabilitation program, not a supplement).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the evidence of Tai Chi Chuan's effect on bone mineral density and its potential for osteoporosis prevention.
results_summary: Five studies showed statistically significant improvements in BMD after Tai Chi Chuan, while three showed nonsignificant differences, and one lacked statistical evaluation. Long-term practice demonstrated better effects.
population_specificity: 1222 participants across various study designs (RCTs, case-control, cross-sectional).
study_duration: Varied, with longer durations showing better results

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether martial arts participation improved mental health outcomes (self-esteem, self-confidence, concentration, and self-discipline) in children, as rated by classroom teachers.
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant effect of martial arts on classroom behavior, with effect sizes close to zero. The data did not support the claim that martial arts improved mental health outcomes in children.
population_specificity: U.S. children attending kindergarten in 1998-1999, followed through 3rd and 5th grades.
study_duration: Measured from kindergarten to 3rd grade and from 3rd to 5th grade.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the health benefits and safety of martial arts as a form of exercise and its potential as a treatment modality for at-risk youth.
results_summary: The study found that martial arts improve overall health, balance, and psychological well-being, while not promoting aggression. It also noted that martial arts are relatively safe, with most injuries being minor, and risks can be mitigated with protective equipment and limiting exposure for inexperienced students.
population_specificity: Youth and general practitioners (physicians evaluating injuries).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of reinforcement and extinction on response variability and stimulus generalization in the punching and kicking techniques of martial arts students across drill and sparring conditions.
results_summary: Both students increased the number of different techniques performed during the drill condition when reinforcement was provided, and this increase generalized to the sparring condition without reinforcement.
population_specificity: 2 martial arts students

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the potential physical, psychological, and therapeutic benefits of martial arts across diverse populations and the importance of understanding its physical demands for injury prevention and treatment.
results_summary: The abstract suggests martial arts may offer benefits for various populations, including pediatric, geriatric, and individuals with disabilities, but emphasizes the need to understand injury risks and safe participation post-injury.
population_specificity: Pediatric, geriatric, and individuals with disabilities.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the origins, health benefits, and modern applications of Martial Arts, emphasizing its role in exercise, sport, and health.
results_summary: The study found that Martial Arts, particularly Tai Chi Chuan, offers health benefits such as improved strength and self-efficacy in the elderly, reduced falls, increased exercise capacity, and positive effects on the immune and autonomic nervous systems. The paper also highlighted the global development and cultural significance of Martial Arts.
population_specificity: General population, with specific mention of the elderly.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a school-linked traditional martial arts course could reduce violence and improve psychological risk factors in high-risk juveniles.
results_summary: The treatment group showed improvement in 12 out of 14 variables, including reduced teacher-rated violence, better self-reported happiness and schoolwork, and improved attention. The control group initially deteriorated but showed similar improvements after taking the course, with violence reductions persisting at follow-up.
population_specificity: 60 boys in a large urban middle school at high risk for violence and delinquency.
effective_dosage: 30 classes, three per week (45 minutes each).
study_duration: Not explicitly stated, but implied to span several weeks based on class frequency.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the injury risk associated with practicing martial arts and compare it to other mainstream activities.
results_summary: The study found that martial arts have a favorable injury rate compared to other activities, with common injuries occurring to the wrist, hand, finger, foot, knee, head, and thigh. Prevention and treatment strategies for these injuries were also discussed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general martial arts practitioners)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether traditionally taught martial arts could serve as an effective treatment alternative for violent adolescents and youth gang members.
results_summary: The study found that martial arts programs emphasizing respect, self-control, leadership, and community service, under trained instructors, could help dysfunctional adolescents cope with violence and family issues. Clinical examples demonstrated successful applications in specialized martial arts schools, residential treatment, and public school classes.
population_specificity: Violent adolescents and youth gang members.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the therapeutic potential of Martial Arts as a supplement to verbal psychotherapy, focusing on its ability to enhance mental and physical health.
results_summary: The study found that Martial Arts improve self-esteem through physical activity, group experience, and teaching relaxation and communication skills, making them a viable therapeutic tool for neurotic and chronically mentally ill patients. Martial Arts also help expose feelings physically, which can then be analyzed in verbal psychotherapy.
population_specificity: Neurotic and chronically mentally ill patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the influence of Kyusho Jitsu martial art training on self-efficacy, distress, fear, and depression in breast cancer survivors.
results_summary: The study found that Kyusho Jitsu training was safe and feasible but not effective enough alone to significantly improve psychological issues in breast cancer survivors, though it may serve as a supplementary intervention. A significant difference was noted in the subscale "joy" between groups.
population_specificity: Breast cancer survivors (N=51, intervention group n=30, control group n=21).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of 6 weeks of carob polyphenol supplementation on body composition and aerobic capacity in youth taekwondo athletes.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding the effects of carob polyphenol supplementation on body composition or aerobic capacity in taekwondo athletes.
population_specificity: Youth taekwondo athletes (age 21.9 ± 1.2 years, BMI 22.8 ± 5.5 kg/m²).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether oil massage as an adjunct therapy could enhance the efficacy of phototherapy in reducing bilirubin levels in neonates with jaundice.
results_summary: The study found that massage combined with phototherapy significantly increased stool and urine output, reduced bilirubin levels faster, and shortened phototherapy duration compared to phototherapy alone. A rebound in bilirubin levels occurred after phototherapy discontinuation in both groups.
population_specificity: Neonates with unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia (160 participants, aged not specified).
effective_dosage: Massage therapy three times daily for 20 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of breast massage and warm compression on milk secretion and anxiety in mothers of premature newborns.
results_summary: The study found that breast massage, warm compression, and their combination significantly increased milk production and reduced maternal anxiety compared to the control group. Mothers reported satisfaction with all interventions, though no significant differences in satisfaction were noted between groups.
population_specificity: Mothers of premature newborns in the neonatal intensive care unit (NICU).
effective_dosage: Not specified (interventions involved massage, warm compression, or both, but exact frequency/duration per session not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess massage therapists' knowledge, confidence, and awareness of domestic and family violence (DFV) in clinical practice.
results_summary: The study found that massage therapists with prior DFV experience were more likely to have undergone DFV training, and a majority expressed a desire for additional training and resources. Over half felt somewhat confident in recognizing DFV signs, but qualitative analysis highlighted a lack of resources and training.
population_specificity: Australian massage therapists aged 18 or older.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of handheld percussive massage on different stimulation areas of the posterior shoulder regarding internal rotation range of motion (ROM) and external rotation muscle strength.
results_summary: The study found that percussive massage increased internal rotation ROM without reducing external rotation muscle strength, with no significant differences observed between the three stimulation areas. No changes in muscle strength were detected post-intervention.
population_specificity: 15 healthy male volunteers (20.6±1.5 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of Traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) combined with Chinese massage therapy (Tui Na) for treating cervical spondylosis (CS).
results_summary: The study found that TCM combined with Tui Na significantly reduced pain levels (VAS score) and improved neck function (NDI score) compared to Tui Na alone, with higher clinical efficacy and improved quality of life.
population_specificity: Patients with cervical spondylosis (CS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of friction massage (FM) on pain intensity, pressure pain threshold (PPT), and joint range of motion (ROM) in individuals with myofascial trigger points (MTrPs).
results_summary: FM significantly improved pain intensity, PPT, and joint ROM within groups, but showed no significant superiority over control groups for pain intensity and PPT. The effect on joint ROM was inconclusive due to controversial findings.
population_specificity: Individuals with myofascial trigger points (MTrPs), particularly in the upper trapezius.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of Tuina massage combined with conventional treatment for post-stroke spasticity (PSS) through a meta-analysis.
results_summary: Tuina massage significantly improved symptoms and quality of life in PSS patients, outperforming the control group in measures like the Modified Ashworth Scale, Modified Barthel Index, and Fugl-Meyer Assessment. The meta-analysis supports its integration into rehabilitation programs for comprehensive PSS management.
population_specificity: Post-stroke spasticity patients (1937 participants across 18 studies).
effective_dosage: Various Tuina techniques (specific dosage not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of massage therapy on pain and anxiety intensity in patients with burns.
results_summary: The study was retracted due to compromised peer review and excessive self-citations, so no valid results can be reported.
population_specificity: Patients with burns.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether aromatherapy massage with mint and sweet almond oils improves sleep quality in traumatic brain injury patients in intensive care units.
results_summary: Aromatherapy massage significantly increased sleep quality in traumatic brain injury patients compared to sham therapy, with a statistically significant improvement (P < 0.05). The intervention group showed a notable increase in mean sleep quality scores post-intervention.
population_specificity: Traumatic brain injury patients admitted to intensive care units.
effective_dosage: Hands and feet massaged for 20 minutes with a combination of mint and sweet almond oils for three consecutive days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of self-administered tennis ball massage therapy for low back pain in elderly individuals.
results_summary: The study found that tennis ball massage significantly reduced low back pain, with mean pain scores decreasing from 6.34 to 2.84 in the experimental group, and the results were statistically significant (p = 0.00001).
population_specificity: Community-dwelling elderly individuals aged 60 years and above experiencing low back pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify body areas for Caring Massage® treatment and assess its influence on both nurses performing it and patients receiving it.
results_summary: The study identified feet, legs, back, hands, shoulders, and arms as key treatment areas. Patient outcomes improved in sleep quality, emotional well-being, and nurse-patient relationship, while nurses reported benefits in physical well-being, body respect, and patient consideration.
population_specificity: Nurses and patients involved in Caring Massage®.
study_duration: Two Delphi rounds conducted between July and October 2024.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Pilates training combined with fascial massage was more effective than Pilates alone in improving muscle activation, body posture, pain, and quality of life in office workers with upper crossed syndrome (UCS).
results_summary: The study found that combining Pilates with fascial massage significantly improved forward head and shoulder angles, cervical spine range of motion, muscle activity, and reduced pain and dysfunction compared to Pilates alone. The experimental group showed better outcomes in all measured parameters.
population_specificity: Office workers diagnosed with upper crossed syndrome (UCS).
effective_dosage: 12 weeks of Pilates training combined with fascial massage (specific frequency not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if a single session of massage therapy could provide immediate relief from chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy (CIPN) symptoms, specifically pain and neuropathy.
results_summary: One massage therapy session significantly reduced moderate-to-severe pain (from 81% to 0%) and neuropathy (from 77% to 12%) among patients, with statistically significant improvements in both measures.
population_specificity: Cancer patients (median age 64, 74% female, 70% White) experiencing CIPN during or after chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of rhythmic embrocation (a massage technique) versus empathic conversation on postoperative stress levels in colorectal cancer surgery patients.
results_summary: Professional rhythmic embrocation showed a greater reduction in stress (measured by heart rate variability) compared to student-administered massage or empathic conversation, though the difference was not statistically significant. No significant differences were found in secondary outcomes like sleep quality, nausea, pain, or mood, and no complications were reported.
population_specificity: Colorectal cancer surgery patients (n=68).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanism by which Traditional Pediatric Massage (TPM) prevents depression-like behaviors in adolescent rats exposed to chronic stress, focusing on the IGF-1/Nrf2 pathway.
results_summary: TPM effectively reduced depression-like behaviors, maintained microglia polarization homeostasis, and resisted neuroinflammation in adolescent rats. The antidepressant effect was partially mediated by activating the IGF-1/Nrf2 pathway, as blocking this pathway with picropodophyllin inhibited TPM's benefits.
population_specificity: Adolescent rats exposed to chronic unpredictable mild stress (CUMS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of birthing ball exercises and sacral massage on maternal and fetal well-being, specifically pain perception and anxiety levels during labor.
results_summary: The study found that birthing ball exercises and sacral massage reduced pain perception and anxiety levels, increased cervical dilatation, and improved maternal satisfaction without adverse effects on fetal well-being.
population_specificity: Primigravidae (first-time pregnant women) in the active phase of labor.
study_duration: During the active phase of labor (exact duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the immediate effectiveness of percussive massage therapy on pain and range of motion (ROM) in field athletes with iliotibial band tightness.
results_summary: The study found a significant decrease in post-treatment pain (mean NPRS score dropped from 5.18 to 2.60) and significant improvements in hip abduction and knee flexion ROM. Most participants responded positively, though a few reported no change in pain levels.
population_specificity: Fifty field athletes aged 20-35 years with iliotibial band tightness.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic potential of abdominal massage for Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD) and its influence on gut microbiota.
results_summary: The study will compare HAMA scores, EEG findings, and gut microbiota changes between GAD patients receiving abdominal massage plus medication and those receiving medication alone, hypothesizing that abdominal massage alleviates symptoms by modulating the gut-brain axis.
population_specificity: 70 GAD patients and 35 healthy controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of Traditional Thai Massage (TTM) and Ultrasound therapy (US) in treating chronic plantar heel pain (PHP) with a Myofascial Trigger Point (MTrP) in the calf.
results_summary: Both TTM and US significantly reduced pain intensity and increased pressure pain threshold (PPT) in the heel immediately after treatment, but only US improved PPT in the calf and ankle dorsiflexion range of motion (DROM). US showed greater pain reduction and DROM improvement compared to TTM.
population_specificity: Sixty patients with chronic plantar heel pain and a Myofascial Trigger Point in the calf.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of midwife/nurse-led non-invasive uterine massage in preventing postpartum hemorrhage (PPH).
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results but indicates the study will evaluate the effectiveness of uterine massage for PPH prevention through a systematic review and meta-analysis.
population_specificity: Postpartum women at risk of or experiencing PPH.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically assess the effects of massage and touch on agitation in dementia patients and determine the optimal intervention design.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that massage and touch significantly improved agitation and behavior problems in dementia patients, with hand, head, and foot massage being particularly effective. Short-term interventions (≤4 weeks) were more effective than longer ones, and the benefits were greater for individuals with less severe dementia.
population_specificity: Patients with dementia experiencing agitation.
effective_dosage: Not specified (various massage types and durations were analyzed).
study_duration: Interventions ranged from ≤4 weeks to >4 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of a single session of relaxation massage before bedtime on sleep quality and quantity in individuals with chronic insomnia symptoms.
results_summary: The study found a statistically significant improvement in sleep efficiency with relaxation massage compared to sham massage and control conditions, suggesting it may help restore fragmented sleep in insomnia sufferers.
population_specificity: 20 healthy individuals (aged 25.5 ± 12.0 years; 6F/14M) with chronic insomnia symptoms (Athens Insomnia Scale ≥16).
study_duration: Single session per condition, spaced one week apart.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the skin-to-bone distance in the interscapular region differs between prone and seated positions during massage.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in skin-to-bone distance between prone and seated positions at the measured points (A and B). Tissue components in some anatomical areas change with posture, while others do not.
population_specificity: 18 healthy males aged 22-63 years, height 161.5-181.5 cm.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining TCM massage with exercise therapy improves pain management, functional muscle activation, and proprioception in patients with knee osteoarthritis compared to exercise therapy alone.
results_summary: The study hypothesizes that TCM massage combined with exercise therapy will yield better outcomes in pain management, knee function, muscle activation, and proprioception, but results are pending as the trial is ongoing.
population_specificity: 106 patients with knee osteoarthritis at Shuguang Hospital, Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of massage combined with lifestyle intervention versus lifestyle intervention alone in reducing obesity-related outcomes in patients with simple obesity.
results_summary: Massage combined with lifestyle intervention significantly reduced body weight, BMI, waist circumference, cholesterol levels, and insulin resistance markers compared to lifestyle intervention alone, with varying effects based on age, treatment intervals, and duration.
population_specificity: Patients with simple obesity (including children, adolescents, and adults).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of hot fomentation versus cold fomentation in managing pain, swelling, joint mobility, and patient satisfaction in acute gouty arthritis.
results_summary: Cold fomentation significantly reduced pain intensity (68% reduction), decreased joint swelling (25% reduction), improved joint mobility (15° increase), and had fewer flare-ups (2%) compared to hot fomentation, which showed modest effects and higher flare-up rates (35%). Patient satisfaction was also higher with cold therapy (85% vs. 30%).
population_specificity: 2,400 patients diagnosed with acute gouty arthritis.
effective_dosage: Hot fomentation (38°C-42°C) or cold fomentation (5°C-10°C) applied twice daily for 20 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of aromatherapy massage on cramp frequency, pain severity, and quality of life in hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: Aromatherapy massage reduced cramp frequency and pain intensity while improving quality of life and activities of daily living, with greater effectiveness in the first weeks. Both aromatherapy and classical massage showed benefits, supported by qualitative data.
population_specificity: Hemodialysis patients experiencing muscle cramps.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of hand massage on pain, emotional symptoms, and physiological parameters in children after abdominal surgery.
results_summary: Hand massage significantly reduced pain and emotional manifestation scores immediately after the intervention, along with a decrease in heart rate, though these effects were not sustained 30 minutes post-massage. No significant difference was observed between groups at the third measurement.
population_specificity: Children aged 7-12 years who underwent abdominal surgery.
effective_dosage: 10-minute hand massage administered once, 3 hours after surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of sacral massage in reducing labor pain and altering labor duration in pregnant women during childbirth.
results_summary: Sacral massage significantly reduced labor pain intensity but did not significantly alter the length of the first labor stage or the total duration of labor. The certainty of evidence for pain reduction was moderate, while evidence for labor duration effects was very low.
population_specificity: Pregnant women during labor.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the utilization and impact of massage therapy (MT) on pain and relaxation in children with acute burns.
results_summary: MT was associated with pain relief in 75.0% of patients reporting pain pre-massage, and 95.3% were content, relaxed, or resting comfortably post-intervention. However, barriers like patient unavailability or short admissions limited MT access.
population_specificity: Children with acute burns admitted to a pediatric burn center (excluding intensive care patients).
effective_dosage: Median duration of 25.0 minutes per session (43 sessions total).
study_duration: Retrospective review spanning January 2022 to July 2023.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of an eye massage device, with and without natural sounds, in reducing anxiety and pain in children receiving dental anesthesia for the first time.
results_summary: Eye massage, especially when combined with natural sounds, significantly reduced anxiety and pain in children during dental anesthesia compared to traditional behavior management techniques. Group A (massage with sounds) showed the greatest reduction in pulse rate and objective pain during injection, though post-anesthesia pain and anxiety scores were similar between massage groups.
population_specificity: 105 children aged 8-10 years requiring inferior alveolar nerve block (IANB) injection for dental treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of abdominal ice massage on blood glucose levels and cardiovascular functions in healthy individuals.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in pulse rate, rate pressure product, and double product immediately after the intervention, and further reductions in random blood glucose, systolic and diastolic blood pressure, pulse rate, mean arterial pressure, rate pressure product, and double product 20 minutes post-intervention. No adverse effects were reported.
population_specificity: 50 healthy volunteers (27 females, 23 males) aged 24.72 ± 5.48 years.
effective_dosage: 20 minutes of abdominal ice massage in a single session.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the most effective percussive therapy protocol for improving lower body flexibility among eight different protocols.
results_summary: The study found that applying massage gun PT three times a week with increasing speeds (1750-2100-2400 rpm) was the most effective protocol, resulting in average increases of 5.8% for hip flexion and 5.6% for ankle dorsiflexion.
population_specificity: Recreationally active healthy adults (n = 35)
effective_dosage: 60 seconds per muscle group (quadriceps, gluteals, hamstrings, calves) on both legs, three sessions per week
study_duration: Not explicitly stated (multiple sessions per week, but total duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of foot reflexology and knee massage with black cumin seed oil versus placebo in reducing pain and fatigue in elderly individuals with knee osteoarthritis.
results_summary: Foot reflexology and knee massage with black cumin oil significantly reduced pain and fatigue in osteoarthritis patients, with foot reflexology being the most effective treatment.
population_specificity: Elderly individuals (over 65 years) with knee osteoarthritis and no perception problems.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the therapeutic effects of positive pressure (massage gun) and negative pressure (vacuum therapy) combined with laser therapy on pain, mobility, and quality of life in workers with back pain.
results_summary: Both positive and negative pressure combined with laser therapy reduced pain and improved spinal flexibility, shoulder mobility, and quality of life compared to the control group. Negative pressure combined with laser showed superior results for lumbar and cervical pain and right shoulder mobility compared to positive pressure.
population_specificity: Workers (male and female, aged 20-60) with work-related musculoskeletal disorders (WMSDs) causing low back, neck, and shoulder pain.
effective_dosage: Once weekly sessions (total of seven sessions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effect of aromatherapy massage on itching and skin pH in individuals with liver diseases.
results_summary: The study found that aromatherapy massage significantly reduced itching scores compared to placebo and control groups, with statistical significance (p = 0.000). The aromatherapy group had a lower mean itching score (10.34) than the placebo (11.92) and control (13.02) groups.
population_specificity: Individuals with liver diseases

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether hand massage could reduce fatigue levels in women undergoing brachytherapy for gynecologic cancer.
results_summary: The study found that hand massage significantly reduced fatigue severity and its impact on daily activities compared to the control group, with statistically significant results (p < 0.05). The intervention was deemed safe and economical for use by certified nurses.
population_specificity: Women with gynecologic cancer receiving brachytherapy (24 participants, 12 per group).
effective_dosage: 5 minutes per hand, totaling 10 minutes per session, applied three times (before each brachytherapy session over 1 week).

study_goal: The researchers sought to determine if manual therapy (massage) could alter key biomarkers of post-irradiation fibrosis in rats and if an experienced therapist could detect irradiated limbs through blinded palpation.
results_summary: Massage reduced serum inflammatory markers in irradiated limbs, and an experienced therapist could detect irradiated limbs via palpation. However, the irradiation dose used did not induce long-lasting deep fibrosis or nerve degeneration, differing from preliminary studies.
population_specificity: Rats with X-ray irradiation to the forelimb
effective_dosage: Protocol previously described and characterized (specifics not provided)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether an infant massage intervention increased mothers' massage frequency and improved infants' attachment security.
results_summary: The study found that mothers in the massage group continued massaging their infants at follow-up (86%), and their infants showed higher attachment security scores. Infants massaged more than once per week had greater attachment security than those massaged less frequently or in the control group.
population_specificity: Mother-infant dyads, primarily with mothers who had preschool-aged children in Head Start and infants under 8 months old, plus some community-based mothers.
effective_dosage: Standard infant massage strokes (frequency: more than once per week for optimal effects).
study_duration: 4 weeks of training, with follow-up at 12 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of a 5-minute massage session on the contractile and passive mechanical properties of the gastrocnemius muscle in young adults.
results_summary: The study found that a 5-minute massage significantly altered contractile and passive mechanical properties in both the lateral and medial gastrocnemius muscles, with varying effect sizes depending on the specific muscle and measured parameter. No differences were observed in other variables.
population_specificity: Healthy young adults aged 19-24.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the average effect of massage for adults with neck pain compared to other standard treatments.
results_summary: Massage showed varied pain reduction for subacute-chronic neck pain, with very-low to moderate-certainty evidence. It may not increase risks of minor adverse events (RR 0.37).
population_specificity: Adults aged 18-70 with neck pain (70% female, mean pain severity 52 VAS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the immediate effects of IASTM and percussive massage therapy (PMT) on static and dynamic balance in young adults with pes planus.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in static balance between groups, but IASTM showed significant improvements in dynamic balance compared to no intervention and PMT. Only the IASTM group exhibited significant differences in most directions of the Y Balance Test post-intervention.
population_specificity: Young adults with pes planus (n=51).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effectiveness of massage therapy on pain, biomechanical changes, and muscle co-contraction in individuals with medial knee osteoarthritis (KOA).
results_summary: Massage therapy significantly improved WOMAC scores (pain, stiffness, function), walking speed, step length, and reduced medial muscle co-contraction, but did not significantly change external knee adduction moment (EKAM) or knee adduction angular impulse (KAAI).
population_specificity: Fifteen participants (2 males, 13 females) with medial compartment KOA, average age 61.33 years.
effective_dosage: Six-week massage intervention (specific frequency not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of traditional Thai massage (TTM) on pressure pain threshold, pain intensity, wrist flexion, and grip strength in young patients with latent myofascial trigger points in the wrist extensor muscles.
results_summary: TTM significantly improved pressure pain threshold, pain intensity, and wrist flexion compared to sham ultrasound therapy, with effects sustained two weeks post-intervention. The sham group also showed improvements, except for pressure pain threshold.
population_specificity: Young patients (mean age ~21 years) with latent myofascial trigger points in the wrist extensor muscles.
effective_dosage: Three 20-minute sessions per week for 9 sessions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of connective tissue massage (CTM) and kinesiotaping (KT) on pain, depression, and quality of life in fibromyalgia patients.
results_summary: Both CTM and KT significantly improved pain, disease impact, depression, and quality of life, with no significant difference between the two interventions. The improvements had very large effect sizes across all measured variables.
population_specificity: 34 patients diagnosed with fibromyalgia (mean age ~35 years).
effective_dosage: CTM was applied 3 days a week, KT was applied 2 days a week, alongside electrotherapy (TENS and infrared treatment) 5 days a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of massage therapy for improving cancer pain, quality of life, and anxiety in cancer patients.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that massage therapy significantly improved pain, quality of life, and anxiety in cancer patients, though the certainty of evidence was very low and most studies had unclear or high risk of bias.
population_specificity: Patients with cancer pain

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the immediate effects of Thai foot massage on renal blood flow, psychological stress, and heart rate variability in older adults.
results_summary: Thai foot massage significantly increased volumetric arterial blood flow and reduced stress, while also enhancing parasympathetic activity markers (SDNN and RMSSD). No significant changes were observed in the control group except for RMSSD.
population_specificity: Healthy older adult volunteers (26 participants, aged not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of aromatherapy massage on pain severity and quality of life in migraine patients during an attack, alongside medical treatment.
results_summary: Aromatherapy massage significantly reduced pain severity (VAS scores) and improved quality of life (total and subscale scores) compared to the control group. The effects were statistically significant (p < .05).
population_specificity: 70 migraine patients (35 experimental, 35 control) visiting an emergency department with migraine pain.
effective_dosage: 15-minute massage with aromatic oil mixture applied to the temple and neck root, frequency not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether pre-performance functional massage (FM) delays the onset of neuromuscular fatigue during exercise.
results_summary: FM significantly delayed neuromuscular fatigue (~80% improvement in PWC<inf>FT</inf>) compared to the control condition, but no significant difference was found in maximal power output.
population_specificity: Thirteen healthy college-aged men (22-28 years old).
study_duration: Single session per condition (two sessions total, separated by at least 7 days).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effectiveness of abdominal massage on chronic constipation symptoms, including defecation frequency, stool consistency, and quality of life, and compare its efficacy across different constipation etiologies and massage techniques.
results_summary: Abdominal massage significantly increased defecation frequency, reduced gut transit time, and alleviated constipation symptoms but did not reduce laxative use. Functional constipation responded better than opioid-induced or neurogenic bowel dysfunction, and acupressure/aromatherapy massage was more effective than circular or electric device massages.
population_specificity: Adults with chronic constipation, including functional constipation, opioid-induced constipation, and neurogenic bowel dysfunction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the rates of spontaneous perineal tears requiring suturing between women receiving warm compresses plus perineal massage versus perineal massage alone during the second stage of labor.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in the rates of perineal tears requiring suturing between the two groups (43.7% vs 45.1%). There were also no differences in first-degree tears, second-degree tears, or OASIS rates between the groups.
population_specificity: Women admitted to a single tertiary university-affiliated hospital during the second stage of labor, excluding those with a history of third-degree perineal tear, nut allergy, fetal death, Crohn's disease with perineal involvement, or delivery number >5.
effective_dosage: Gentle perineal massage with almond oil during active maternal pushing; warm compresses applied between contractions for 10-30 minutes at 45°C to 59°C.
study_duration: During the second stage of labor (active fetal descent and maternal pushing).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of connective tissue massage on postmenopausal symptoms, menopause-specific quality of life, and insomnia.
results_summary: The massage group showed greater improvement in menopausal symptom severity, hot flash frequency, quality of life, and emotional status compared to the control group, though no significant effect was observed for insomnia severity.
population_specificity: 57 postmenopausal women (28 in the massage group, 29 in the control group).
effective_dosage: 3 sessions per week, each lasting 15 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of combining five-tone therapy with acupoint massage in reducing chemotherapy-related symptoms and improving quality of life in lung cancer patients.
results_summary: The treatment group showed a higher total effective rate (92.50%) compared to the control group (85.00%), indicating that the combination therapy was more effective in managing chemotherapy-related symptoms like nausea and vomiting.
population_specificity: 80 lung cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effect of Hegu point ice massage and music on pain and comfort levels in nursing students with dysmenorrhea.
results_summary: The study found that Hegu point ice massage significantly reduced pain levels compared to the control and music groups at multiple time points, while music also reduced pain compared to the control. Post-test comfort scores showed significant improvement in the intervention groups.
population_specificity: Nursing students with dysmenorrhea (n=129).
effective_dosage: Intervention performed on the first and second days of menstruation.
study_duration: Two days (first and second days of menstruation).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of 6 weeks of percussive massage therapy on thoracolumbar fascia structure, pain, and disability in firefighters with chronic non-specific low back pain.
results_summary: Percussive massage therapy significantly reduced thoracolumbar fascia echo intensity, alleviated pain, and improved functional disability, but did not alter fascia thickness. The PT group showed statistically significant improvements compared to the control group.
population_specificity: Firefighters with chronic non-specific low back pain (38 participants, aged 23.6±1.7 to 26.6±4.1 years).
effective_dosage: Not specified (intervention included PT and core stability exercise).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy of meridian massage in treating lumbar disc herniation (LDH) compared to routine treatment.
results_summary: The study found that meridian massage significantly reduced pain (VAS), improved disability (ODI), and enhanced lumbar function (M-JOA) compared to routine treatment alone, with statistically significant results (P<0.05).
population_specificity: 82 patients (58 males, 24 females) aged 19-55 with lumbar disc herniation, divided into observation and control groups.
effective_dosage: Not specified (meridian massage applied based on routine treatment).
study_duration: 3 courses of treatment (exact duration per course not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of Valsalva maneuver (VM) versus carotid sinus massage (CSM) in converting supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) to sinus rhythm.
results_summary: VM demonstrated a higher success rate than CSM in treating SVT, with modified VM (mVM) showing particularly high efficacy, though this was based on a single RCT. Subgroup analyses indicated both standard VM (sVM) and mVM were more effective than CSM.
population_specificity: Patients with supraventricular tachycardia (SVT).
effective_dosage: Not specified (vagal maneuvers were the interventions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the acceptability, appropriateness, feasibility, and adoption of a perineal massage and warm compress intervention by midwives in a maternity ward.
results_summary: The study found high acceptability, appropriateness, and feasibility of the intervention, with midwives adopting it into clinical practice, leading to reduced episiotomy rates and improved perineal protection techniques.
population_specificity: Midwives in a maternity ward of a tertiary hospital in Portugal.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the short-term effects of connective tissue massage (CTM) and classic massage (CM) on pain, functional and emotional status, and menstrual complaints in women with primary dysmenorrhea (PD).
results_summary: Both CTM and CM reduced menstrual pain intensity, duration, drug use, and improved functional and emotional status. CTM was superior to CM in reducing pain duration, improving functional status, and alleviating sleeplessness.
population_specificity: Women with primary dysmenorrhea (PD).
study_duration: From the estimated date of ovulation to the onset of the next menstruation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a 4-week HAMMAM program combining hydrotherapy and Swedish massage in a multisensorial environment for alleviating endometriosis-related chronic pelvic pain and improving well-being and quality of life.
results_summary: The HAMMAM intervention significantly improved dysmenorrhea and dyspareunia with large and moderate effect sizes, respectively, and reduced pain interference during sleep and increased pressure pain thresholds in the pelvic region. No significant effects were observed for catastrophizing thoughts, overall well-being, or quality of life, except for the sleep subscale.
population_specificity: Women with endometriosis-related chronic pelvic pain unresponsive to conventional treatment (n=44).
effective_dosage: Not specified (integral HAMMAM experience combining hydrotherapy and Swedish massage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the therapeutic effects of needle warming moxibustion combined with trigger point massage on shoulder function and stress responses in elderly patients with frozen shoulder.
results_summary: The study found that the combination treatment significantly improved shoulder function, reduced pain, shortened recovery times, and lowered stress response and inflammatory markers compared to conventional treatment, with a lower recurrence rate.
population_specificity: Elderly patients with frozen shoulder (116 participants, aged not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of shiatsu massage on pain and anxiety during labor in nulliparous women.
results_summary: Shiatsu massage significantly reduced labor pain and anxiety scores in the intervention group compared to the control group, which experienced increases in both measures. The effects were statistically significant across all measured time points.
population_specificity: Nulliparous pregnant women giving birth in low-risk maternity clinics in Samarinda, Indonesia.
effective_dosage: Not specified (standard protocols followed by certified midwives).
study_duration: Administered during labor (latent and transition phases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of a two-week plantar massage intervention on gait kinematics and kinetics in individuals with chronic ankle instability (CAI).
results_summary: The study found that two weeks of plantar massage did not significantly alter gait biomechanics (ankle sagittal or frontal plane positions or COP location) in individuals with CAI. The results suggest gait-specific interventions may be needed to modify biomechanics in this population.
population_specificity: 60 participants with chronic ankle instability (CAI), with 18 per group in the final analysis.

study_goal: To investigate the effectiveness and parental experience of infant abdominal massage in reducing parental stress levels.
results_summary: Infant abdominal massage significantly reduced parental stress levels in the intervention group (mean difference -5.46, p = .049). Parents reported positive experiences despite uncertainties affecting compliance, with improved satisfaction and perceived worth.
population_specificity: 160 parents (mothers and fathers) recruited from 10 mother groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of reflexology foot massage versus standard foot massage on sleep, anxiety, and quality of life in hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: Reflexology foot massage improved sleep quality, reduced state anxiety, and enhanced quality of life compared to standard foot massage in hemodialysis patients.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing hemodialysis treatment
effective_dosage: 15 minutes per foot, three times a week

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of tactile massage on ADHD core symptoms, sleep ability, pain perception, and stress levels in adolescents.
results_summary: Tactile massage significantly reduced hyperactivity/impulsivity, inattention, and oppositional defiant disorder symptoms, and improved sleep ability. Pain perception showed a non-significant reduction.
population_specificity: Adolescents aged 15-17 with a prior ADHD diagnosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic effect of TCM nursing technology combined with TCM massage on elderly patients with functional constipation.
results_summary: The study found that TCM massage, especially when combined with medicine ironing, significantly improved clinical efficacy, reduced TCM syndrome scores, and increased bowel movement frequency and fecal characteristics compared to conventional Western medicine. Safety profiles were comparable across groups.
population_specificity: Elderly patients with functional constipation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the effect of roller massage on BDNF levels in men undergoing self-massage.
results_summary: The study found that roller massage significantly increased BDNF levels after the first, fifth, and seventh weeks compared to the control group, with fluctuations observed during the intervention period. Higher BDNF concentrations suggest a potential biological mechanism for massage's therapeutic effects.
population_specificity: Men undergoing self-massage (specific age or health status not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of foot reflexology versus simple massage on vital signs, anxiety, and pain in children with thalassemia undergoing blood transfusions.
results_summary: Simple massage significantly reduced temperature, anxiety, and pain in children with thalassemia. It also showed a significant impact on systolic blood pressure and pain post-intervention, though foot reflexology was more effective overall.
population_specificity: Children aged 2-13 years with thalassemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of traditional Chinese medicine acupoint massage combined with acupoint application on constipation characteristics, defecation difficulties, and quality of life in patients with solid heat constipation induced by psychogenic drugs.
results_summary: The observation group (acupoint massage combined with application treatment) showed superior improvement in stool characteristics, defecation difficulty, and quality of life compared to the other intervention groups, with statistically significant results (P < .05 and P < .01).
population_specificity: 150 hospitalized psychiatric patients with intestinal solid fever constipation.
study_duration: May 2019 to August 2020 (exact intervention duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of tactile massage (TM) on improving psychological health (loneliness, anxiety, depressive symptoms) and physiological markers in older residents of long-term care facilities.
results_summary: The study found no significant improvements in loneliness, anxiety, or depressive symptoms, but the TM group showed significant improvements in comfort, relaxation, respiratory rate, and systolic blood pressure compared to the control group.
population_specificity: Older residents in long-term care facilities.
effective_dosage: 15 minutes per session, twice a week.

study_goal: To compare the effectiveness of dynamic cervical electrical stimulation combined with manual therapy versus manual therapy alone in treating myofascial temporomandibular pain.
results_summary: The study found that combining electrical stimulation with manual therapy resulted in significantly better outcomes for pain intensity, pressure pain sensitivity, mouth opening, and active cervical range-of-movement compared to manual therapy alone. These improvements were observed immediately after intervention and at a 4-week follow-up.
population_specificity: 46 participants with bilateral myofascial temporomandibular pain for at least three months.
effective_dosage: Not specified (2-week protocol with unspecified frequency).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether traditional Thai massage (TTM) as an adjunctive therapy could reduce depression severity and improve quality of life in individuals with major depressive disorder (MDD) already on antidepressant medication.
results_summary: The TTM group showed a statistically significant reduction in depression scores (HAM-D) compared to the control group after eight weeks, suggesting TTM may enhance the effectiveness of antidepressant therapy and improve quality of life.
population_specificity: Forty-eight individuals diagnosed with severe depressive illness and undergoing antidepressant medication.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of sodium chloride-fortified coconut (SCFC) oil massage on cardio-respiratory characteristics in healthy volunteers.
results_summary: The study found that SCFC oil massage increased sympathetic activity, evidenced by decreased average rr and increased heart rate, with no significant changes in GSR or RR. Systolic blood pressure showed significant differences over 30 minutes post-intervention.
population_specificity: Healthy volunteers aged 18-25 years, including both males and females.
study_duration: 5 minutes post-intervention measurements, with blood pressure monitored over 30 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review and summarize recent literature on pharmacological and non-pharmacological therapies, including Massage, for postoperative pain management after thoracic surgery.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings regarding Massage's effects, as it broadly reviews multiple therapies without detailing results for any single intervention.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing thoracic surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether manual therapy (including massage) combined with exercise provides greater improvements in pain and disability outcomes for low back pain (LBP) patients compared to exercise alone.
results_summary: The study found that manual therapy as an adjunct to exercise improved short-term pain, function, and disability outcomes in LBP patients more than exercise alone, with eight out of ten included studies reporting benefits.
population_specificity: Adults and older adults suffering from chronic low back pain for over three months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of a heated eye mask (HEM) and eyelid massage device (EyePeace) in improving signs and symptoms of evaporative dry eye (EDE) and meibomian gland dysfunction (MGD).
results_summary: The study found that combining a heated eye mask with eyelid massage (EyePeace) improved tear film lipid layer (TFLL) and meibomian gland expressibility (MGEx) scores, though the improvements were not clinically significant. No significant changes were observed in other measured outcomes like redness score, ocular surface temperature, or corneal parameters.
population_specificity: Forty participants with dry eye.
effective_dosage: 10 minutes of HEM therapy followed by eyelid massage using EyePeace.
study_duration: Assessments were made at baseline, 5, 15, and 30 minutes post-intervention.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify opportunities for improving postoperative pain management in thoracic surgical patients and provide evidence-based recommendations.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about Massage; it focuses on the need for better pain management strategies and the variability in current analgesic regimens.
population_specificity: Thoracic surgical patients experiencing postoperative pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of various interventions, including massage, in treating depression symptoms in perinatal women.
results_summary: Interpersonal therapy plus massage was the highest-ranking intervention for treating perinatal depression symptoms, with a significant standardized mean difference compared to treatment as usual.
population_specificity: Perinatal women (pregnant or postpartum)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically evaluate the efficacy and safety of Tuina (a traditional manual therapy) in treating functional dyspepsia (FD) in children.
results_summary: Tuina, alone or combined with conventional therapy, significantly improved efficacy rates, reduced dyspeptic symptom scores, and shortened symptom resolution times compared to conventional therapy alone. No adverse events were reported in the Tuina group.
population_specificity: Children with functional dyspepsia (1336 participants across 10 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of facial massage on nasal septum injury and stress in premature infants receiving noninvasive mechanical ventilation (NIMV) support.
results_summary: Facial massage was found to be more effective than the control in reducing stress scores in premature infants, though it was less effective than hydrocolloid patches in preventing nasal injuries and improving skin condition.
population_specificity: Premature infants between 28 and 34 gestation weeks receiving NIMV support in a neonatal intensive care unit (NICU).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of a new multimodal device (MGrx) for meibomian gland debridement and expression, which includes massage, against conventional treatment methods for evaporative dry eye disease.
results_summary: Both treatments significantly improved dry eye symptoms without deterioration for at least 8 weeks, with no significant difference between groups. The MGrx device was found to be safe, effective, and offered logistical advantages over conventional treatment.
population_specificity: 30 participants (mean age 36.4 ± 15.4 years; 77% female) with dry eye disease and meibomian gland dysfunction.
study_duration: Effects assessed at 4 and 8 weeks post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of hand and foot massage in managing pain and anxiety after a cesarean section.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that hand and foot massage significantly reduced pain immediately after, 60 minutes, and 90 minutes post-cesarean section, and improved anxiety on the first day after the procedure.
population_specificity: Women who underwent a cesarean section (581 participants across 7 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the immediate effects of thoracic mobilization and soft tissue release (including massage) on trunk movement, pain, and muscle activity in patients with chronic low back pain.
results_summary: Both interventions improved trunk range of motion, pressure pain threshold, tissue hardness, and reduced muscle activation, with mobilization showing greater benefits in side bending, rotation, and tissue hardness, while soft tissue release more effectively reduced lumbar muscle activation.
population_specificity: 28 participants with chronic low back pain.
effective_dosage: Not specified (thoracolumbar fascia release and massage in the lumbar region).
